channel.title: NPC Dialogue triggered through an area?
channel.description:
What i'm stuck on is, when you say, walk into an area on your map, I'd like it to trigger a certain NPC Dialogue from my methods, but i'm a bit stuck on it,
What i basically want is when you walk into say, The Barbarian Village, you will hear one of the barbarians shout; "Halt there, your kind is not welcome here!", that's the basic concept.
I thought the code snippet would be like this; [code] boolean isInArea(XXXX, YYYY, XXXX, YYYY) { npcDialogue(); return = true; // Not sure if needed, but i would say so. [/code]
Sorry for not using indentions or anything, it wouldn't let me, anyway, does anybody have an idea?

item.title: NPC Dialogue triggered through an area?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

What i’m stuck on is, when you say, walk into an area on your map,
I’d like it to trigger a certain NPC Dialogue from my methods, but i’m a bit stuck on it,

What i basically want is when you walk into say, The Barbarian Village, you will hear one of the barbarians shout; “Halt there, your kind is not welcome here!”, that’s the basic concept.

I thought the code snippet would be like this;

boolean isInArea(XXXX, YYYY, XXXX, YYYY) {
npcDialogue();
return = true; // Not sure if needed, but i would say so.

Sorry for not using indentions or anything, it wouldn’t let me,
anyway, does anybody have an idea?
